Loyalists.fluff: Loyalists are those who are yet to give up on the galactic hegemony. They fight against increasingly bleak odds to preserve order against a galaxy filled with renegades, pirates and alien monstrosities. Loyalist fleets field heavy ships with reinforced prows. They are experts at long ranged missile attacks followed by deadly broadside bombardments made with cannons and lasers.

specialRules.name: Armoured Prows
specialRules.description: Loyalist ships treat the armour values of their non-frigate ships as being one point higher against attacks originating from their front arcs. This has no effect against bombing runs. This does not stack with the +1 armour bonus for ships sealing their hatches.

specialRules.name: Dictatorial Command
specialRules.description: Loyalist fleets may roll one additional command dice in each round. They may have up to seven command dice on the board at one time. This ability is lost if they lose their flagship.

commandAbilities.name: Charge Shields
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship/squadron. Those ship(s) immediately regain all lost shields.

commandAbilities.name: Maneuvering Thrusters
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship/squadron. The ship(s) may immediately make a turn up to 90 degrees.

commandAbilities.name: Devastating Firepower
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. All of their cannons are at +1 to hit this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Pulse Lasers
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. This activation, their lasers inflict two hits on a natural roll of 6.

commandAbilities.name: Advanced Missiles
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. All of their missiles gain +1 to hit for this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Full Speed Ahead
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate one of your capital ships. It may not turn, but increases its maximum speed by 6".

Renegades.fluff: Renegades are those who have broken with the galactic hegemony, leaving tyranny in exchange for the promise of freedom. However, with the galaxy collapsing around them, they have taken to raiding and piracy in order to survive. Their ships are focused around long ranged turrets coupled with powerful laser batteries that wither the defenses of their enemies from afar.

specialRules.name: Shadow From the Void
specialRules.description: Renegade fleets may wait for their opponent to finish setting up their entire fleet before deploying any of their ships.

specialRules.name: Agile Maneuvers
specialRules.description: Renegade enslaver squadrons may choose to make a bonus turn, up to 45 degrees, at the start of their movement.

commandAbilities.name: Scramble Fighters
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship with fighter bays. That ship immediately gains one fighter token.

commandAbilities.name: Engine Overcharge
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship/squadron. Increase their movement speed by +2 for this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Devastating Firepower
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. All of their cannons are at +1 to hit this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Point Defense
commandAbilities.description: Use when one of your ships is declared the target of a bombing run. Add +2 to your ship's flak value for this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Hit and Run
commandAbilities.description: Use at the end of a capital ship's activation. The ship makes a turn up to 450 and moves half its speed directly forwards.

commandAbilities.name: Signal Jam
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship/squadron within 12" of an enemy. Remove one die from the opponents command board.

Ancients.fluff: The ancient ones have traveled the stars long before the galactic hegemony ever took root. It is said that they are the outcasts of a distant, powerful empire far beyond the galactic reach. Ancient ships are smaller and more fragile than those of their human counterparts, but they have powerful shield systems and deadly weaponry that more than make up for this.

specialRules.name: Superior Shields
specialRules.description: Ancient ships may use their shield systems to deflect damage from sources which normally ignore shields. This includes bombing runs, missile attacks, boarding actions, ramming and self destructing ships. It does not include asteroids.

specialRules.name: Enhanced Weapons Systems
specialRules.description: Ancient ships gain a +1 bonus to hit with attacks from lasers, missiles and cannons.

specialRules.name: Few in Number
specialRules.description: Ancient fleets begin with 20% fewer points than other factions. This means that in a standard 30 point game they only get to take 24 points worth of ships.

commandAbilities.name: Clairvoyance
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. This activation, Ignore the -1 penalty for shooting into terrain.

commandAbilities.name: Void Flicker
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a squadron of Whispers. For this activation, they may ignore all terrain effects while moving.

commandAbilities.name: Rapid Maneuver
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship/squadron. All of their turns during their normal movement may be up to 90 degrees.

commandAbilities.name: Evasion
commandAbilities.description: Use when one of your ships is targeted by an enemy ship. Shooting for this activation is at -1 to hit your ship.

commandAbilities.name: Quick Shots
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship/squadron. They may perform their shooting before their movement, instead of after.

commandAbilities.name: Agile Hit and Run
commandAbilities.description: Use at the end of a capital ship's activation. The ship makes a turn up to 900 and moves half its speed directly forwards.

Brutes.fluff: Brutes are mutants from the most inhospitable parts of the galaxy. They have a long history of piracy and violence. Brute vessels are normally ramshackle and crude, built by scavenging parts and bolting them together. Brute ships are slower than most and their weapons often lack range. But their durability and short-ranged firepower are truly formidable.

specialRules.name: Piratical
specialRules.description: Brutes receive +1 to all dice rolls made during a boarding action, as either the attacker or the defender.

specialRules.name: Ramming Prows
specialRules.description: Brute ships roll +2 attack dice whenever ramming enemy vessels. They may continue their activation even if they suffer hull damage while ramming.

specialRules.name: Scavenger Craft
specialRules.description: Whenever a brute ship launches a bombing run, its bombers receive a -1 penalty to hit if the target of the attack is more than 12" away.

commandAbilities.name: Pirate Tactics
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship/squadron. They move freely through asteroid and debris fields this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Full Speed Ahead
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate one of your capital ships. It may not turn, but increases its maximum speed by 6".

commandAbilities.name: Reckless Boarding
commandAbilities.description: Use after shooting with one of your capital ships. They may preform an imediate boarding action.

commandAbilities.name: Point Blank Firepower
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. Receive +1 to hit against targets within 6" this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Perseverance
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships. Ignore the penalty for being below half starting hull points for this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Iron Locusts
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a squadron of Cutters. They may immediately make a turn up to 90 degrees.

Cyborgs.fluff: The Cyborgs were augmented by the galactic hegemony to act as enforcers. Since then they have broken their programing and now seek to carve out a new future with themselves as the dominant power. The cyborgs are few in number, but their technology and crew-skills are beyond exceptional. Their fleets are very durable and their weapons punch well above their weight class.

specialRules.name: Elite Troops
specialRules.description: Cyborgs receive +1 to all dice rolls made during a boarding action, as either the attacker or the defender.

specialRules.name: Enhanced Weapons Systems
specialRules.description: Cyborg ships gain a +1 bonus to hit with attacks from lasers, missiles and cannons.

specialRules.name: Few in Number
specialRules.description: Cyborg fleets begin with 20% fewer points than other factions. This means that in a standard 30 point game they only get to take 24 points worth of ships.

commandAbilities.name: Charge Shields
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship/squadron. The ship(s) immediately regain all lost shields.

commandAbilities.name: Overcharge Engines
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship/squadron. Increase their movement speed by +2 for this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Perseverance
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships. Ignore the penalty for being below half starting hull points for this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Point Defense
commandAbilities.description: Use when one of your ships is declared the target of a bombing run. Add +2 to your ship's flak value for this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Advanced Missiles
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. All of their missiles gain +1 to hit for this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Evasion
commandAbilities.description: Use when one of your ships is targeted by an enemy ship. Shooting for this activation is at -1 to hit your ship.

Insectoids.fluff: Insectoids have long been exploited by the hegemony—their queens held hostage and their drones controlled by a cocktail of artificial pheromones. With galactic unrest, many hives have been able to break away from hegemonic rule and are seeking vengeance on the human species. Insectoids specialize in swarming with squadrons of smaller vessels and clouds of biological fighter-craft.

specialRules.name: Bio-ships
specialRules.description: Insectoid ships cannot be boarded, but may initiate boarding actions of their own. They gain +1 on all of their dice during boarding actions.

specialRules.name: Predatory
specialRules.description: When insectoid ships initiate a ramming action, they can make a single 45 degree turn following at least 4 inches of movement.

specialRules.name: The Swarm
specialRules.description: For each squadron of Pincers you include in your list, you may include an additional free Pincer squadron, armed as you choose. For the purpose of victory points, pincers are worth 1/2 of a point each. You may only spend up to half of your fleets total points on Pincer squadrons.

commandAbilities.name: Chitinous Swarm
commandAbilities.description: Use when you finish activating a squadron of Pincers. Immediately activate another Pincer squadron.

commandAbilities.name: Angry Maw
commandAbilities.description: Use when you declare a ramming action with a ship/squadron. Your ship(s) add two attack dice to their ram.

commandAbilities.name: Barbed Spines
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. All of their spine cannons are at +1 to hit this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Acidic Spray
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. This activation, their lasers inflict two hits on a natural roll of 6.

commandAbilities.name: Spawn Fighters
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship with hive bays. That ship immediately gains one fighter token.

commandAbilities.name: Stinging Cloud
commandAbilities.description: Use when you initiate a bombing run. Add one to each of your dice to determine the number of attacks.

Mining Guilds.fluff: The Mining Guilds are older than even the Hegemony and have established themselves in baron sectors and at the edge of asteroid belts. They harvest valuable minerals under grueling and dangerous conditions and are no strangers to conflict. Mining guild fleets are slow and defensive, able to turn their mining equipment into powerful weapons at a moment's notice.

specialRules.name: Deflectors
specialRules.description: Mining guild ships reduce the number of dice rolled when moving through asteroid fields by 1. They ignore all hits from debris fields.

specialRules.name: Rear Plating
specialRules.description: Mining guild ships have armoured engines, meaning that enemy ships do not get a +1 to hit when targeting their rear arcs.

specialRules.name: Mining Charges
specialRules.description: Mining charges work exactly the same as missiles, but do not suffer the -1 to hit for firing at short range or the penalty to hit targets inside of terrain.

commandAbilities.name: Mineral Scanners
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. This activation, Ignore the -1 penalty for shooting into terrain.

commandAbilities.name: Glance Off
commandAbilities.description: Use when one of your ships rams or is rammed. The enemy ship suffers -2 on their ramming attack rolls.

commandAbilities.name: Primed Charges
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. This activation, their mining charges receive +1 to hit.

commandAbilities.name: Defensive Tactics
commandAbilities.description: Use after you finish shooting with a ship/squadron. They may immediately seal their hatches.

commandAbilities.name: Focused Beam
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. This activation, their drilling lasers extend their range to 18".

commandAbilities.name: Haul Iron
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship/squadron. This activation, add +2 to their speed. This cannot be used on a Guild Fortress.

Merchants.fluff: Merchant convoys are forces assembled by the wealthiest individuals in the galaxy with the expressed purpose of moving goods and earning a profit. These convoys are often dragged into the conflicts plaguing the galaxy, and while the merchants are not warriors by trade, they have more than a few tricks up their sleeves when it comes to defending themselves.

specialRules.name: Mercantile
specialRules.description: Merchant capital ships that leave the battlefield only grant one third of their points to the opposing player.

specialRules.name: Wealthy
specialRules.description: Merchant fleets may include 20% more points in ships. This means that in a standard 30 point game they may include up to 36 points of ships.

specialRules.name: Civilian Crews
specialRules.description: Merchant ships suffer a -1 penalty to all of their rolls made while boarding or being boarded.

commandAbilities.name: Emergency FTL
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship. Remove it from the battlefield. It counts as having left the board.

commandAbilities.name: Defensive Tactics
commandAbilities.description: Use after you finish shooting with a ship/squadron. They may immediately seal their hatches.

commandAbilities.name: Maintain Distance
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. Receive +1 to hit against targets over 6" this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Anti-Piracy Measures
commandAbilities.description: Use when one of your ships is boarded. Subtract two from the number of boarding attacks made by the enemy ship.

commandAbilities.name: Protect the Goods
commandAbilities.description: Use when you declare intercepting enemy bombers or missiles. Add one to each die to determine the attacks negated.

commandAbilities.name: Improvisation
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship. Do not spend this die. Instead move it to any location on the command board.

Disciples.fluff: The Disciples are religious zealots on a grand crusade to liberate the souls of the galaxy's population. Thanks to the tenets of their faith, those who can not be converted in life can still be redeemed in death. The disciples lack in tactical prowess and military experience, but are crazed enough to fling themselves into even the most dangerous fight, heedless of the cost.

specialRules.name: Fearless
specialRules.description: The weapons of the disciples never suffer any penalties for their ships being below half their maximum hull points.

specialRules.name: Cleansing Flame
specialRules.description: Whenever a disciple's capital ship self destructs, the explosion hits all vessels within 3" of it, be they friend or foe (see page 16). However, they only ignore the shields of ships they are in base contact with.

specialRules.name: Rain of Rockets
specialRules.description: Hull mounted missile racks ignore the penalty for shooting at targets within 6 inches.

commandAbilities.name: Blaze of Glory
commandAbilities.description: Use when one of your capital ships is destroyed. It is counted as self destructing (see cleansing flame).

commandAbilities.name: Zeal
commandAbilities.description: Use when one of your ships boards an enemy or is boarded. Add +1 to each of its attack rolls for this boarding action.

commandAbilities.name: Burning Spears
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with a squadron of Torchbearers. This activation, they double the attacks of their prow weapons.

commandAbilities.name: One way Trip
commandAbilities.description: Use when you initiate a bombing run. Add one to each of your dice to determine the number of attacks.

commandAbilities.name: Brimstone Rockets
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. This activation, its missiles ignore the enemy flak value.

commandAbilities.name: Sabotage
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a capital ship within 12" of an enemy ship. The enemy vessel gains a sitting duck token.

Scrap Bots.fluff: Scrap bots were created long ago to collect and re-purpose debris scattered around the galactic flotsam. Over the centuries their programing has gone more than a little haywire, especially once they realized that the best way to find scrap was to blow things up. They now build massive junk-flotillas to wage war on anyone and anything.

specialRules.name: Unplanned Construction
specialRules.description: do not select weapons for your ships. At the start of the game roll randomly for each hull weapon D6: 1-2 cannons, 2-4 lasers, 5-6 missiles.

specialRules.name: Drone Bays
specialRules.description: Drone bays launch drone tokens. These work exactly like fighter tokens but can not be sent out on bombing runs.

specialRules.name: Industrious
specialRules.description: Scrap Bots fleets may include 20% more points in ships. This means that in a standard 30 point game they may include up to 36 points of ships.

commandAbilities.name: Reconstruct
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship. It may spend its drone tokens to recover lost hull points on a one to one basis.

commandAbilities.name: Erratic Warheads
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. This activation, its missiles ignore the enemy flak value.

commandAbilities.name: Blocking Protocol
commandAbilities.description: Use when a ship is targeted by enemy cannons. It may spend a drone token to reduce the incoming attacks by D6.

commandAbilities.name: Junk Run
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a squadron of junk runners. During this activation they gain +4" speed.

commandAbilities.name: Salvage Scrap
commandAbilities.description: Use when a ship is destroyed (friend or foe) select one of your ships within 6" to immediately recover one lost hull point.

commandAbilities.name: Drone Shield
commandAbilities.description: Use when one of your ships is targeted by enemy lasers. You may sacrifice drone tokens as though they were shields.

Dusk Wraiths.fluff: Long ago an ancient civilization rivaled the power of the emerging Galactic Hegemony, but they where wiped out by a deadly bio-weapon. Those few who survived were forced to seal their dying bodies in necro-suits and flee to the darkest corners of the galaxy. Long have they plotted their revenge against the living.

specialRules.name: Leech Lasers
specialRules.description: Whenever leech lasers deal damage to a target's shields, the attacking ship may immediately recover lost shields equal to the damage dealt.

specialRules.name: Energy Drain
specialRules.description: Whenever an enemy ship is activated, it suffers 1 damage to its shields for each Dusk Wraith ship within 6".

specialRules.name: Terrifying Decor
specialRules.description: Whenever an enemy ship boards one of yours, their boarding attacks are made at a -1 penalty.

commandAbilities.name: Vampiric Warhead
commandAbilities.description: Use when you deal hull damage to an enemy ship using missiles. That ship immediately gains a sitting duck token.

commandAbilities.name: Risen Warriors
commandAbilities.description: Use when you board an enemy ship with one of your capital ships. Roll 2 additional boarding attacks.

commandAbilities.name: Shadow Shroud
commandAbilities.description: Use when one of your ships is targeted by an enemy ship. Shooting for this activation is at -1 to hit your ship.

commandAbilities.name: Beguile
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship within 12" of an enemy ship. You may immediately turn the enemy ship up to 45 degrees.

commandAbilities.name: Void Flicker
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a squadron of Dark Thralls. For this activation, they may ignore terrain effects while moving.

commandAbilities.name: Carrion Feast
commandAbilities.description: Use when a ship is destroyed (friend or foe) select one of your ships within 6" to immediately recover one lost hull point.

Liberationists.fluff: For centuries, the peoples of the galaxy have cried out for freedom! Rebel cells have formed in every major colony, gathering ships and resources. Everywhere all at once these liberationists strike at the dying vestiges of the Galactic Hegemony. Though they have little in common, all have heard the cry for interstellar self-determination!

specialRules.name: Mega Cannons
specialRules.description: These cannons treat all normal hits as rolls of a six (even if 6s were required.)

specialRules.name: Cyclone Gun
specialRules.description: These are treated as cannons but do not score double hits on rolls of 6.

specialRules.name: Motley Crew
specialRules.description: Every capital ship in your fleet starts the game with random capital ship advancement (as seen on page 50 of the Void Admiral rules)

specialRules.name: Individualistic
specialRules.description: Your fleet has no flagship but will always roll five command dice.

commandAbilities.name: Gunship Drift
commandAbilities.description: Use after you finish moving a squadron of liberty gunships. They may all immediately turn up to 90 degrees.

commandAbilities.name: Trigger Happy
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. This activation, their cyclone guns each gain +2 attacks.

commandAbilities.name: Missile Bombardment
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. This activation, their missiles increase their range to 24".

commandAbilities.name: Hull-Breaker Rounds
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. This activation, their mega cannons get +1 to hit.

commandAbilities.name: Rebel Aces
commandAbilities.description: Use when you initiate a bombing run. Add one to each of your dice to determine the number of attacks.

commandAbilities.name: Strong and Independent
commandAbilities.description: Use when you finish activating a capital ship and it is outside of 12" from any allies. It gains a hatches sealed token.

Fungoids.fluff: Furtive nebula worlds bathed in cosmic radiation are often home to fungoid life. These unusual beings build their star-ships from a mixture of both fungal and inorganic materials. Though they traditionally shy away from conflict, the fungoids have been driven to war, hoping to finally stamp out animalian life.

specialRules.name: Spore Tokens
specialRules.description: When a ship with spore tokens activates, it suffers one damage to its shields for each spore token it has. Fungoid ships instead recover lost shields for each spore token they have. Ships then remove all of their spore tokens at the start of their movement. Ships may never have more than three spore tokens at once.

specialRules.name: Break Apart
specialRules.description: fungoid ships gain one spore token for each hull damage they sustain.

specialRules.name: Spore Missiles
specialRules.description: These missiles do not double their hits on rolls of 6. However, for each hit they inflict on an enemy ship, that ship receives one spore token.

commandAbilities.name: Regenerative Spores
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship. Instead of recovering shields, each spore token it has repairs a lost hull point.

commandAbilities.name: Migrating Spores
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship. Instead of recovering shields, move each spore the ship has to any other ship within 12".

commandAbilities.name: Explosion of Spores
commandAbilities.description: Use when one of your capital ships is destroyed. Place one spore token on each ship within 12".

commandAbilities.name: Persistent Spores
commandAbilities.description: Use when you or your opponent activates a ship/squadron. The ship's spore tokens are not removed this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Spore Amplification
commandAbilities.description: Use when you target an enemy ship with lasers. Roll additional attacks equal to the number of spore tokens on the target ship.

commandAbilities.name: Spore Corrosion
commandAbilities.description: Use when you target an enemy ship with cannons. Roll two additional attacks for each spore token on the target ship.

Lost Colony.fluff: Betrayed by the Galactic Hegemony and trapped on the far side of a wormhole, the lost fleets of the Human Alliance were forced to establish colonies on barren worlds. Finally their ancestors have returned, seeking answers and perhaps vengeance. They are carving a path through the outer reaches, bound for the core worlds.

specialRules.name: Fleet Logistics
specialRules.description: Lost Colony capital ships may spend fighter tokens from allied ships within 6" of them as though they were their own.

specialRules.name: Ionized Hulls
specialRules.description: Lost Colony ships have outdated shield technology. Their ships may only recharge lost shields if they have a hatches sealed token.

specialRules.name: Carrier Fleet
specialRules.description: Lost Colony ships with fighter bays may each deploy an extra fighter token at the start of the game.

commandAbilities.name: Scramble Fighters
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship with fighter bays. That ship immediately gains one fighter token.

commandAbilities.name: Assault Boats
commandAbilities.description: Use when you board an enemy ship. You may spend one fighter token to add +D6 boarding attacks.

commandAbilities.name: Torpedo Bombers
commandAbilities.description: Use when one of your ships shoots with missiles. It may spend fighter tokens to add +D6 attacks per token spent.

commandAbilities.name: Combined Firepower
commandAbilities.description: Use when one of your ships shoots with cannons. It may spend fighter tokens to add +D6 attacks per token spent.

commandAbilities.name: Point Defense
commandAbilities.description: Use when one of your ships is declared the target of a bombing run. Add +2 to your ship's flak value for this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Quick Launch
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship with launch bays and a hatches sealed token. It immediately gains one fighter token.

Technocrats.fluff: The last century of Hegemonic rule has been one of stagnation and stifling bureaucracy. Many of humanities greatest scientists abandoned the core worlds and set up secluded research stations along the outer reaches. Recent conflicts have stopped most forms of research—other than, of course, weapons testing.

specialRules.name: High Frequency Shields
specialRules.description: Technocrats always treat their ship's flak value as being equal to its current shield strength. Technocrat squadrons can't use flak support.

specialRules.name: Advanced Weapons
specialRules.description: Technocrat cannons and missiles ignore all ranged penalties, and their lasers ignore the penalty for attacking small targets.

specialRules.name: Scientists
specialRules.description: Technocrat ships suffer a -1 penalty to all of their rolls made while boarding or being boarded.

commandAbilities.name: Weapon Transposition
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship/squadron. Exchange its weapons for any assortment of weapons available to its class.

commandAbilities.name: Charge Shields
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship/squadron. Those ship(s) immediately regain all lost shields.

commandAbilities.name: Toxic Miasma
commandAbilities.description: Use when you board an enemy with a capital ship. Roll no boarding attacks. Deal D3 damage to the target's hull.

commandAbilities.name: Bypass Shield Frequency
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. For this activation its lasers ignore enemy shields.

commandAbilities.name: Micro Wormhole
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate one of your ships. Move it to anywhere on the table, facing any direction. End its activation.

commandAbilities.name: Teleporter Bomb
commandAbilities.description: Use before you shoot with a capital ship. Target an enemy ship within 6" who's shields are down. Deal one hull damage.

Shadow Weavers.fluff: The Shadow Weavers are a traveling troupe of entertainers, sooth sayers and scribes. They move from world to world, speaking with the locals and recording their stories. Little is known of their motives, save that they seem to be looking for something or perhaps someone. They enter conflict mercilessly, without warning or provocation.

specialRules.name: Stealth Fields
specialRules.description: Shadow Weaver ships can not seal their hatches. Whenever a Shadow Weaver ship ends its activation outside of 12" of any enemy vessels, it gains a special stealth token that lasts until it is next activated. Shooting and bombing run attacks made against ships with a stealth token are at -1 to hit.

specialRules.name: Holographic Deception
specialRules.description: After deployment, before the start of the game, the Shadow Weaver player may remove and re-deploy up to half of their ships/squadrons.

specialRules.name: Assassin's Blades
specialRules.description: Shadow Weaver lasers double all hits against enemy ships when attacking them in their rear arc.

commandAbilities.name: Chronological Disruption
commandAbilities.description: Use when you finish an activation. Choose an unactivated enemy ship/squadron. Your opponent must activate them.

commandAbilities.name: Twisting Shadows
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a squadron. One ship remains stationary. Remove and place the others anywhere within 2" of it.

commandAbilities.name: Stealth Augments
commandAbilities.description: Use when you finish activating a ship within 12" of an enemy ship. Your ship gains a stealth token.

commandAbilities.name: Deadly Weave
commandAbilities.description: Use when your opponent moves a ship through terrain. It suffers four attacks, hitting on a 4+ (with double hits on 6s).

commandAbilities.name: Phantom Shift
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a capital ship. You may immediately Move that ship 3" in any direction without changing its facing.

commandAbilities.name: Storm Missiles
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with a ship/squadron. This activation their missiles get +1 to hit and do not ignore shields.

Scavengers.fluff: Wherever there is conflict there are sure to be Scavenger clans, lurking about and waiting to pick apart the husks of fallen ships for valuable technology and supplies. It is rare that these raiders involve themselves in full-scale conflict, but sometimes the opportunity is too great for them to resist.

specialRules.name: Inertial Shielding
specialRules.description: Scavengers do not recover lost shields at the start of the round. Instead, for every 4" a Scavenger ship moves, they may restore one lost shield.

specialRules.name: Pillagers
specialRules.description: Whenever a scavenger ship boards an enemy ship and deals one or more damage, gain one bonus victory point (does not work if the enemy ship self-destructs).

specialRules.name: Ambushers
specialRules.description: During the first turn of the game your opponent rolls no command dice.

specialRules.name: Sew Chaos
specialRules.description: At the start of the turn your opponent gains one fewer command dice for each of their capital ships within 6" of one or more scavenger ships.

commandAbilities.name: Pirate Tactics
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a squadron of Bandits or Ruffians. They make an immediately turn up to 90 degrees.

commandAbilities.name: Iron Locusts
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship/squadron. They move freely through asteroid and debris fields this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Hit and Run
commandAbilities.description: Use at the end of a capital ship's activation. The ship makes a turn up to 450 and moves half its speed directly forwards.

commandAbilities.name: Electromagnetic Pulse
commandAbilities.description: Use when you board an enemy ship. They may not self-destruct, and your boarding attacks gain +1 to hit.

commandAbilities.name: Electromagnetic Warhead
commandAbilities.description: Use when you deal hull damage to an enemy ship using missiles. That ship immediately gains a sitting duck token.

commandAbilities.name: Tricks and Traps
commandAbilities.description: Use when your opponent moves a ship through terrain. It suffers four attacks, hitting on a 4+ (with double hits on 6s).

Cragborn.fluff: The Cragborn come from high gravity worlds surrounded by asteroid belts. They are themselves creatures with a rock-like appearance. Cragborn ships are crafted from asteroids and are fitted with engines, weapons and shields. While historically content to war amongst themselves, their tribes have become increasingly aggressive.

specialRules.name: Earthen Shield
specialRules.description: Cragborn shields can block missiles and bombing run attacks. Additionally crag-born ships treat their armour as 2 versus lasers (instead of 1).

specialRules.name: Can't Stop Won't Stop
specialRules.description: Cragborn ships must move 6" before each turn (instead of the usual 4") Additionally if they don't move at least 4" during their activation, they suffer one automatic hull damage in addition to gaining a sitting duck token.

specialRules.name: Meteoric Impact
specialRules.description: Crag-born ships get +2 to hit when rolling ramming attacks.

commandAbilities.name: Rock Wardens
commandAbilities.description: Use when you declare intercepting enemy bombers or missiles. Add one to each die to determine the attacks negated.

commandAbilities.name: Alter Trajectory
commandAbilities.description: Use when you finish activating a capital ship. They may immediately turn up to 45 degrees.

commandAbilities.name: Gain Momentum
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship/squadron. This activation, add +2 to their speed.

commandAbilities.name: Stone to Stone
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship/squadron. They move freely through asteroid and debris fields this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Focusing Crystals
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. This activation, their laser crystals extend their range to 18"

commandAbilities.name: Shard Bombardment
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. This activation, their missiles increase their range to 24".

Pack Hunters.fluff: Pack hunters from beyond the outer reach are known raid outlying sectors for sport. Little is known of these terrible warriors, only that they wear the pelts of great beasts and that they are deadly in melee combat. These raids have become more common in recent times—as if the hunters can smell blood in the void.

specialRules.name: Hunter's Spears
specialRules.description: These missiles treat all normal hits as rolls of a six (even if 6s were required.) This only works against targets who's shields are down.

specialRules.name: Fearsome Attackers
specialRules.description: Pack Hunters treat all normal hits as rolls of a six during boarding actions, but only when they are the attacker.

specialRules.name: Hunter's Prey
specialRules.description: 'Call the Hunt' Delegates a special prey token that remains in play until the target is destroyed. All ships in the hunting pack gain a +1 to hit against the prey when shooting and boarding. A new prey token can never be issued until the target is destroyed.

commandAbilities.name: Call the Hunt
commandAbilities.description: Use as you activate your flagship. Declare an enemy ship to receive a special prey token (see above).

commandAbilities.name: Shadow Spears
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. This activation, its missiles ignore the enemy flak value.

commandAbilities.name: Small Game
commandAbilities.description: Use before you shoot with a ship or squadron. They may ignore the -1 penalty to hit for small targets.

commandAbilities.name: Refractive Armour
commandAbilities.description: Use when one of your ships is targeted by enemy shooting. Lasers suffer a -2 penalty to hit your ship this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Pack Tactics
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a squadron of Jackals. They may immediately make a turn up to 90 degrees.

commandAbilities.name: Slashing Claws
commandAbilities.description: Use before you shoot with a ship or squadron. Each of their cannons gain +2 attacks when targeting enemies within 6".

options.name: Fighter Bay
options.note: A Blood Hound may only have one Fighter Bay.

Psychic Slugs.fluff: A vindictive species of psychic mollusks are known to be the Galactic Hegemony's oldest confidants. They alone have been granted the rights to manage their own minor empire outside of Hegemonic laws. With the galaxy descending into conflict, these greasy gastropods are eager to expand their domain.

specialRules.name: Sludge Rockets
specialRules.description: For each point of hull damage these missiles inflict on an enemy ship, the target also suffers 1 damage to its shields.

specialRules.name: Heavy Fighters
specialRules.description: Psychic Slug fighters may not issue bombing runs against targets outside of 12" away. However, their bombing run attacks gain +1 to hit.

specialRules.name: Absorb Secrets
specialRules.description: At the start of the turn, you gain one additional command dice for each enemy capital ship within 6" of one (or more) of your ships.

commandAbilities.name: Unwitting Saboteur
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship within 12" of an enemy ship. The enemy vessel gains a sitting duck token.

commandAbilities.name: Spoil Plans
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship within 12" of an enemy. Remove one die from the opponents command board.

commandAbilities.name: Cloud Vision
commandAbilities.description: Use when one of your ships is targeted by an enemy ship. Shooting for this activation is at -1 to hit your ship.

commandAbilities.name: Beguile
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship within 12" of an enemy ship. You may immediately turn the enemy ship up to 45 degrees.

commandAbilities.name: Induce Betrayal
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship within 12" of an enemy ship. The enemy ship loses all of its fighter tokens.

commandAbilities.name: Clairvoyance
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. This activation, Ignore the -1 penalty for shooting into terrain.

Noble Houses.fluff: With the impending Hegemonic collapse, many planetary governors have fled to the safety of the core worlds. This mass-migration has caused an upheaval in the power dynamics of the established noble houses, with many weaker families being pushed out. Exiled houses are forced to take to the stars in the hopes of finding a new haven.

specialRules.name: Cull the Rabble
specialRules.description: Noble House ships never suffer the -1 penalty to hit small targets.

specialRules.name: Tight Ranks
specialRules.description: Noble House capital ships add +1 to their flak values for each honour guard ship within 2".

specialRules.name: Reflexive Shielding
specialRules.description: Whenever a Noble House ship gains a hatches sealed token, it immediately may recover one lost point of shields.

commandAbilities.name: Escape Pods
commandAbilities.description: Use when one of your capital ships is destroyed. Your opponent receives one less victory point for destroying it.

commandAbilities.name: Elite House Guards
commandAbilities.description: Use when one of your ships is boarded. You may roll two additional attacks to repel the boarders.

commandAbilities.name: Maintain Distance
commandAbilities.description: Use before shooting with one of your ships/squadrons. Receive +1 to hit against targets over 6" this activation.

commandAbilities.name: Superiority
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship/squadron. All of their turns during their normal movement may be up to 90 degrees.

commandAbilities.name: Sworn Shield
commandAbilities.description: Use after you finish shooting with a squadron of honour guard. They may immediately seal their hatches.

commandAbilities.name: Scramble Fighters
commandAbilities.description: Use when you activate a ship with fighter bays. That ship immediately gains one fighter token.
